title: ScamViruS
author: ScamViruS
created_time: February 05, 2023, 06:43:28 PMLast edit: February 06, 2023, 06:47:23 PM by ScamViruS
content: Due to fake reviews, it is difficult to choose which is the real website and which is the bad website. They want to confuse users with fake 5 stars on platforms like Trustpilot. We can't overlook the OP as a newbie account, because those who offer such services will definitely contact with the OP and continue their activities.Profile : https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?action=profile;u=3533118Thread Link: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5438123.0Archive: https://archive.is/MSUiJ

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: It is no more new that some websites are full of fake reviews, there are some fake sites with fake reviews too. Review can help to some extent, but we should not full depend on it. Assuming I am looking for an exchange, I can check Trustpilot, but that is not the end, I will still check sites like Coingecko and also check online to know if the site is good or not. Reviews are helpful at times, but we should not fully depend on it because some are just fake. There are many things to consider while researching about a site. You can even check how old the site is and also asking on this forum if the site is good or not.

comments.author: Husires
comments.body: I have seen what he is trying to sell, but I think that buying positive reviews is a waste of time because when you find a new site with a lot of positive 5-star reviews, it is suspicious, especially since all these reviews will be in a short period of time and then there are no new reviews.I see that the user is careful, he used a new account and will give the link on Telegram, so giving him fair Trustpilot ratings will give him a lesson more than negative trust.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: I posted on that link that buying a review in Trustpilot will backfire if clients are not satisfied with what you are offering if you have a good product or service then you don't need to buy reviews just ask your clients or buyers to do a review on your products or services if your product or service is bad then you will be tempted to buy positive reviews, improve on what you are offering then you will not have to buy reviews.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: unfortunately, there is little we can do here, except to become aware that no review is necessarily true. we can tag this user, but that will not prevent him from coming next month with a new account and offering this service again. Even in spite of negative tags, it does not have to prevent interested parties from buying his services.The worst part of all this is buying a "bad" review rating. anyone can buy a negative rating for a competing company, and this is where more serious damage can be seen.

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Whether he said 5$ for an honest review or 5$ for only a good review, it is still the same IMO. There are a lot who are not going to leave a true review in most cases, they just want to get paid. Not everyone is that way, but it's hard to believe anything you read on trustpilot. I'd rather see how a company represents themselves and their business on the forum and decide whether their behavior warrants me visiting their site.

comments.author: goku88
comments.body: my sales increase in 400% since i start buying reviews

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: If one is trying to choose if a website is legitimate or not, trustpilot is not the solution. If the website is open source, you can verify the codes and if you don't know how to, check on the GitHub channel. If it's closed source, check the date the website was created and check for scam discussions around it on different platforms. Also check for variations to the web link.Quote from: examplens on February 05, 2023, 10:41:05 PMwe can tag this user, but that will not prevent him from coming next month with a new account and offering this service again. Even in spite of negative tags, it does not have to prevent interested parties from buying his services.As you pointed out, people buying fake reviews for their platform would not be bothered if the user selling it has a negative tag on the forum.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Come on, he can just create multiple accounts and create fake reviews about his site without need to pay $5 to each review. I know Trustpilot disallow to create multiple accounts and they might ask KYC in the future, but they have a rule to not allow fake review, of course they have no way to verify this if the case isn't big and they're not aware if the site is clearly scam.Although it's not wrong to leave tag and flag to this account, but he has nothing to lose anyway.

comments.author: John Abraham
comments.body: Quote from: goku88 on February 06, 2023, 01:39:11 AMmy sales increase in 400% since i start buying reviews  I am not sure if you are for real or just trolling here. Stop making such a bullshit comment. The business is all about honesty and legitimacy. You don't have to buy reviews if your business is legit. You don't have to jump. Be patient, and you will get the trust of users slowly. If you are a scammer, the words are not for you. The thief never listens to regional quotes. A long ago, Duckdie was accused of buying fake reviews. Then they stopped. Right now, 1xbit is buying fake reviews and paying TrustPilot to remove negative reviews.

comments.author: Aanuoluwatofunmi
comments.body: The more reasons why you should conduct your research very well, there have been fake reviews nowadays and only the newbies may not be familiar with this kind of trick, only work by what you're convinced about not what they offer or you heard, trustpillot to me is not enough reason why you should decide for choosing a website, check all their informations and licensing documents to see if they are legitimate or not, this is what you do by yourself and you don't expect anyone to take it for you.

comments.author: MFahad
comments.body: Anyone have contacted this users which type of website he has? I don't know if there is another social media platform where this tagged user  can ask for review why he choose this forum for creating fake review . Maybe this forum users are more related to crypto and their review is valuable. This users is smart enough that he used new account for this purpose because he knew the results. QuoteCome on, he can just create multiple accounts and create fake reviews about his site without need to pay $5 to each review I think there will some IP tracing or something else this user cannot create multiple review. He claiming that his sale has been Raised 400% after fake review. Maybe some users contacted him through PM. My question is how can we report Trustpilot to remove these fake reviews ?

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: goku88 on February 06, 2023, 01:39:11 AMmy sales increase in 400% since i start buying reviews  What you are doing may harm other users, if they use your web service you really have bad intentions here, by paying for dishonest reviews on the Trustpilot web, cases like this are not much different from 1xBit.com, who knows how much they pay some users, misleading.I'm pretty sure your sales don't last long, if you have bad intentions, your service will also be flooded with negative reviews on the Trustpilot web.

comments.author: ScamViruS
comments.body: Quote from: goku88 on February 06, 2023, 01:39:11 AMmy sales increase in 400% since i start buying reviews  No matter how much growth you get in the short term by using dishonest methods, your methods will not always save you. Because you are cheating your customers with these fake reviews. Many others like you came with various dishonest methods but they also disappeared with time. So don't get too excited about this sudden change, maybe soon your karma will show up with the right results for you!

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Nothing is going to stop OP to buy fake reviews until his post gets deleted. The people who want to post the fake review will contact him and get the job done for $5. Tagging him or doing anything to this account isn't going to stop the fake review offering party I think.By the way, your thread is misleading, mate. The user is offering to buy fake reviews, not to sell.

comments.author: Edwardard
comments.body: Quote from: Little Mouse on February 06, 2023, 03:58:52 PMNothing is going to stop OP to buy fake reviews until his post gets deleted.Unfortunately, his post will stay due to scams not being moderated. However, if anyone can DM him in the name of providing review and get more details about his site and post it here, then we can warn others to not visit or deal with that site ever.Quote from: Little Mouse on February 06, 2023, 03:58:52 PMTagging him or doing anything to this account isn't going to stop the fake review offering party I think.This will just end up like the scam 1xbit sig. campaign then where whoever gets involved gets tagged.
